items.description: Identification as a randomised trial in the title
items.example: A randomised controlled trial of intervention X versus control Y

items.description: Structured summary of trial design, methods, results, and conclusions
Scientific background and explanation of rationale
items.example: Previous studies have shown... Therefore, this trial aims to...
The primary objective is to determine whether...

items.description: Description of trial design (such as parallel, factorial) including allocation ratio
items.example: This is a parallel-group, randomised controlled trial with 1:1 allocation

items.description: Important changes to methods after trial commencement, with reasons
items.example: The protocol was amended on [date] to change...

items.description: Settings and locations where the data were collected
items.example: The trial was conducted at 3 academic medical centers

items.description: Interventions for each group with sufficient details
items.example: Intervention group received... Control group received...
The primary outcome was change in blood pressure at 12 weeks
Sample size was calculated to detect a difference of...

items.description: When applicable, explanation of any interim analyses and stopping guidelines
items.example: Interim analyses were planned after enrollment of...

items.description: Method used to generate random allocation sequence
items.example: Randomisation was performed using computer-generated random numbers

items.description: Type of randomisation; details of any restriction
items.example: Block randomisation with varying block sizes was used

items.description: Who generated the sequence, enrolled participants, and assigned to interventions
items.example: The randomisation sequence was generated by... Participants were enrolled by...

items.description: If done, who was blinded after assignment to interventions and how
items.example: Participants, investigators, and outcome assessors were blinded

items.description: Statistical methods used to compare groups for primary outcomes
items.example: The primary analysis used intention-to-treat principle with...

items.description: Methods for additional analyses, such as subgroup analyses
